alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 11:40PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Alabama, including the following county, DeKalb. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Payne, Crossville, Geraldine, Skirum, Lebanon, Collbran, Rodentown, Lathamville, Dog Town, Painter, Kilpatrick, Arona, Adamsburg, Little River Canyon NP and Desoto State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
